intro: Primula modesta f. nivea, commonly known as the snowy primrose, is a hybrid form of the modest primrose, characterized by its pale white to cream-colored flowers. It is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and slightly hairy on the underside. Its flowers bloom in early spring, forming clusters of five to seven petals. This variety is valued for its delicate appearance and is often cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
